newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU says US action against meat exports unjustified.
newsitem.headline: EU says US action against meat exports unjustified.

text.p: United States action against European Union meat exports is unjustified on health grounds and highly regrettable, a European Commission spokesman said on Tuesday.
"There's no justification for any of this action on health grounds and this is a health matter," Commission agriculture spokesman Gerard Kiely said. "It's a very regrettable move."

Kiely added that as far as the EU was concerned discussions with the United States on the mutual recognition of meat and poultry inspection methods were continuing and Washington's action would not make the talks easier.
"All we ask is that non-EU countries introduce measures that give the same guarantees regarding health protection for EU consumers as our own rules do within the Community," Kiely said.

Kiely was reacting after a senior U.S. Agriculture Department official said that the U.S. will from today implement a new inspection system of EU meat and slaughter plants that is likely to halt imports of some $300 million of EU meat.

Washington's move came after the EU said on Tuesday it had started new veterinary controls on imports of about $50 million of poultry meat annually from the United States after failure to agree on inspection controls by an April 1 deadline.
